intro: Aristea ecklonii, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped inflorescences that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the year.
